comment: Professor Peterson knows a lot about the subject but doesn't teach it very well. Although I came out with an A in the class, I was left having to teach myself each chapter. I would not take this professor again if I had the chance. Although very nice as a person, he was a terrible professor.

I thought Professor Peterson was very easy to understand and walked us through the problems until everyone understood it. Most of the people who think he's a bad teacher just don't listen to what he has to say. I took chemistry in high school and never understood any of the concepts until he explained them with detail.

AVOID! He is one of the worst teachers e ever had. He posts powerpoints that you will not understand unless you go to the class, but even then they are still confusing. He doesnt understand when a question is asked, and talks about something completely different. His test are only 30 questions so if you miss a few, there goes your grade.

Okay, Dr. Peterson can't really teach but he does mean well. If at all possible, don't take him. But he is willing to help you after class. He has the weirdest analogies and examples. Sometimes if you ask him a question, he'll say "We'll get to that later," and never get to it. If you do the homework and read, you'll be fine.

AVOID AVOID AVOID. I honestly have no idea how this man has a teaching job. He actually told our class once that we wouldn't need calculators or the periodic table for the tests!! If you are unlucky enough to be stuck with him, go to class for the possibility of pop quizzes--not to learn. You will be teaching yourself all semester long.

I am currently taking Laurence Peterson this semester. the tests are 60% of your final grade. i made an 80 on the first, and just got back my second with an 87. I watch online videos and teach myself so hopefully i can get an A. He is nice but simply CANNOT teach. I leave class more confused than when I came in. Prepare to teach yourself to pass

AVOID. He is terrible at lecturing. He simply does not know how to explain things. Left class more confused than when I came. More than once I have had to ask him to correct my grade. If you take him read your book and go to the free chemistry tutoring lab that the university offers. Saved my grade. An A is possible, but you have to work for it.
Worst. Teacher. Ever.

All my quiz grades in the gradebook are wrong. 10 points have been deducted from each grade because he can't enter them right. Such an unhelpful professor; I resulted in emailing my high school chemistry teacher for help. Teach yourself and live by the book if you end up taking him, which I don't recommend doing.

He's not the best. VERY unclear and unorganized.. I taught myself everything from the book. His quizzes are online and they're still impossible. Smart man but can't explain worth anything. Try someone else if possible.
do not take he is absolutely horrible

He does not teach the course. You have to rely on yourself and your textbook to learn all of the material. Whenever a student asks a question he does not answer it or goes off about something completely different. Nice man who enjoys chemistry but a terrible professor. If you are used to teaching yourself then go for it. AVOID!!!!

This guy is truly awful. He never answers a question directly,he will say say me after class, then when you see him after class he tells you if you read it again and you still don't understand then ask me next class. How helpful is that. I feel that if you don't know a little about chemistry before you take his class then you will be vey frustrated

Honestly, he's a horrible prof! However, just study a lot, read the materials yourself, don't bother about the powerpoints, and basically learn the material on your own. I have an A+ but that's because I had extreme chemistry in HS and I self-taught myself. His tests are super crazy easy..if you know the material but don't depend on him to teach it

Horrible Professor, contradicts himself constantly and while the book has the right answer he will state its wrong tests are easy but hard to study for because he cannot teach! I recommend you do not take him if you do smart thing is too hire a tutor.

Do NOT take this professor. It isn't that he is hard, he is just a flat out bad professor, which makes the class hard. He contradicts himself with just about everything and hardly teaches. He just rambles about the topics and doesn't really go in depth, give examples, and expects you to be a chem wiz. I had to self teach myself all semester.
Do not take this man if you have a brain!

He is not good teacher, but his tests so easy. I got 100 on first and 83 on second cause didn't sleep before the test. He gave on the test questions from the quiz and other questions the are the basics.His quizzes very hard and timed,but they are only 5% of the grade. Easy "B" if you read the chapters.

Will never take him again! He always contradicts what he says, his online quizzes are timed and you will always finish with seconds left. He thinks we should just get Chemistry, doesn't explain anything. Also if he makes a mistake, it is our problem & he won't give you credit back if the mistake is on a quiz..even though it is his fault.

This professor is a nice old man but awful. He's not good at explaining the theory. He contradicts himself at times. He asks wrong questions and makes incorrect statements in the hopes that we will correct him and that we will learn that way. I just am not absorbing much from him. His quizzes online are awful and not clear. DO NOT TAKE HIM!

This class....sucks . The teacher is contradictory, and does not teach the class in a way that is helpful to students . When questions are asked, the majority of the time the answer is "we'll get to that later" . I am starting to realize that "later" is never . If you take his class, be prepared to teach yourself the majority of the material .
